text: hi everyone
Anthony Fantan oh here the Internet's
busiest music nerd and we're gonna do a
quick little review of the new Power
Trip album manifest decimation this is
the debut full-length of power trip a
metal outfit hailing from Texas and they
bring together the sounds and the Rivage
of thrash metal with the brashness and
speed of punk with some gang vocals as
well over the years there have been
quite a few thrash metal revivalist
acts to come out and release some pretty
decent records some of them kind of
technical and progressive like vector
others really just a harsh angry
aggressive like toxic Holocaust while
others take a more sort of very
conservative approach and just really
maintain the style just do it by the
blueprint but still you know some decent
songs on their records evil who I mean
is really just like a group of metallica
worshippers or havoc which is really
just a group of Megadeth worshippers and
powertrip is definitely in that
revivalist camp as well essentially
power trip is to crossover thrash metal
what the exploding hearts are to power
pop you have this group that is living
today but sound exactly like they came
out with this record like 30 or 40 years
ago it's it's really hard to believe
because power trip sounds exactly like
cro-mags or suicidal tendencies not only
down to the kinds of riffs that they
play the way that they structure their
songs and the vocals but the recording
is well the guitar playing on this
record is fast there are loads of
whaling whammy bar solos and noodling
some hefty breakdowns and plenty of
reverb on the vocals and the drums
really giving the recording here a very
Bumi sort of distance sound except for
the guitars which are right up front and
center if there is an issue with this
record though it is very much crossover
thrash by the numbers I'm not sure if I
heard a single idea on this record that
I could be like ah this is a power trip
idea I thought it was fun for a few
listens and
and for sure I can't really deny that
power trip is doing this style of music
incredible justice I mean their take on
this style of music is is really
accurate but is it creative I guess is
the question however a lot of people out
there including me occasionally love
revivalist acts and for sure when it
comes to metal music specifically
crossover thrash powertrip is one of the
better ones I've heard this year if
you've given this record listen what did
you think of it did you love it did you
eat it why what do you think I should
review next and that's it
Anthony Fantana power trip
you
